intro: Anemone flammula, commonly known as the lesser crown imperial, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has basal leaves that are palmately lobed and hairy, giving it a distinct appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Anemone flammula is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate climates.
